    • Class org.fun.game.tetris.Tetrion extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      3677056500763739209L

      • Serialized Fields

          Has the game started?

          Is the game paused?

          javax.swing.Timer timer
          The refresh thread.
          See Also:

          Number of frames since the last drop occurred.

          int framesContinouslySoftDropped

          Tetrion.actionPerformed(ActionEvent)

          Number of lines cleared.

          The held piece.
          See Also:
          Tetrion.holdPiece(), Hold piece

        • holdPieceAvailable

          boolean holdPieceAvailable
          Is hold piece available yet?
          See Also:
          Tetrion.holdPiece, Tetrion.holdPiece()

        • insideDangerZone

          boolean insideDangerZone
          Is the stack inside the danger zone?
          See Also:
          Tetrion.BOARD_CEILING, Tetrion.BOARD_CEILING_DANGER_ZONE, Tetrion.pieceDropped()

        • playfield

          Tetromino.Shape[] playfield
          This is where the action is.

          The playfield is the grid into which Tetrominoes fall, also called the "well" (common in older games) or the "matrix" (especially in more recent Tetris brand games). The playfield is surrounded by a frame called the Tetrion, which controls the overall behavior of Tetrominoes.

        • shapeGenerator

          java.lang.Thread shapeGenerator
          Shape generator thread.

          Shapes are generated in a separate thread to prevent delay in the gameplay.

          See Also:
          Tetrion.nextShapes, Tetrion.newPiece()

        • nextShapes

          java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<E> nextShapes
          Next shapes queue.

          The shapes are filled by the Tetrion.shapeGenerator thread until the queue is full. The BlockingQueue will also make the thread asking to take a piece wait until the queue is not empty (should never happen...).

        • lockDelayFrameCount

          int lockDelayFrameCount
          Lock delay count.

          Counts the number of frames between drop and lock of the falling piece.

          See Also:
          Tetrion.fallingPiece, Tetrion.SRS_LOCK_DELAY

        • droppingHard

          boolean droppingHard
          Is hard drop in progress?
          See Also:
          DropHardAction, ReleaseDropHardAction, Tetrion.hardDrop(), Tetrion.isDroppingHard(), Tetrion.setDroppingHard(boolean), Drop

        • droppingSoft

          boolean droppingSoft
          Is soft drop in progress?
          See Also:
          DropSoftAction, ReleaseDropSoftAction, Tetrion.softDrop(), Tetrion.isDroppingSoft(), Tetrion.setDroppingSoft(boolean), Drop

        • shiftDelayCount

          int shiftDelayCount
          Shift delay count.

          Positive values counts frames between first shift and start of auto shift, negative value counts frames between each auto-shifts.

          See Also:
          Tetrion.AUTO_SHIFT_DELAY, Tetrion.AUTO_SHIFT_PERIOD

        • shiftingLeft

          boolean shiftingLeft
          Is left shift in progress?
          See Also:
          ShiftLeftAction, ReleaseShiftLeftAction, Tetrion.isShiftingLeft(), Tetrion.setShiftingLeft(boolean)

        • shiftingRight

          boolean shiftingRight
          Is right shift in progress?
          See Also:
          ShiftRightAction, ReleaseShiftRightAction, Tetrion.isShiftingRight(), Tetrion.setShiftingRight(boolean)

        • rotationsNeeded

          int rotationsNeeded
          Count the rotations needed.

          Negative value stands for left rotations, positive values stands for right rotations.

        • rotatingLeft

          boolean rotatingLeft
          Is left rotation in progress?
          See Also:
          RotateLeftAction, ReleaseRotateLeftAction, Tetrion.isRotatingLeft(), Tetrion.setRotatingLeft(boolean), Rotate

        • rotatingRight

          boolean rotatingRight
          Is right rotation in progress?
          See Also:
          RotateRightAction, ReleaseRotateRightAction, Tetrion.isRotatingRight(), Tetrion.setRotatingRight(boolean), Rotate

        • levelUpSpeedUpRatio

          double levelUpSpeedUpRatio
          Ratio applied to Tetrion.gravity on each Tetrion.level up.

        • wallKickEnabled

          boolean wallKickEnabled
          Are wall kicks enabled?

          A wall kick happens when a player rotates a piece when no space exists in the squares where that Tetromino would normally occupy after the rotation. To compensate, the game sets a certain number of alternative spaces for the Tetromino to look.

          See Also:
          Wall kick

        • floorKickEnabled

          boolean floorKickEnabled
          Are floor kicks enabled?

          A floor kick, like a wall kick, happens when a player rotates a piece when no space exists in the squares where that Tetromino would normally occupy after the rotation when rotating against the floor opposed to a wall. To compensate, the game sets a certain number of alternative spaces for the Tetromino to look.

          See Also:
          Tetrion.wallKickEnabled, Floor kick

        • lockDelay

          long lockDelay
          Lock delay refers to how many frames a Tetromino waits while on the ground before locking.

          Classic games lock Tetrominoes immediately once it has fallen to the ground, while some newer games give the Tetromino some time before locking.

          See Also:
          Tetrion.SRS_LOCK_DELAY, Tetrion.CLASSIC_LOCK_DELAY, Lock delay, Infinity

        • infiniteLockDelayEnabled

          boolean infiniteLockDelayEnabled
          Is infinity mode enabled?

          Infinity is The Tetris Company's term to refer to a characteristic in recent Tetris Guideline-compliant games where the lock delay of a Tetromino is reset whenever it is moved or rotated (even O, which ordinarily does not rotate).

          See Also:
          Tetrion.SRS_LOCK_DELAY, Lock delay, Infinity

        • refreshHoldPanelNeeded

          boolean refreshHoldPanelNeeded
          Is a refresh of the hold space needed?
          See Also:
          Tetrion.drawHold()

        • holdPanel

          javax.swing.JPanel holdPanel
          Hold space display panel.
          See Also:
          Tetrion.holdPiece

        • refreshPreviewPanelsNeeded

          boolean refreshPreviewPanelsNeeded
          Is a refresh of the preview panels needed?
          See Also:
          Tetrion.drawNextShapes()

        • previewPanels

          javax.swing.JPanel[] previewPanels
          Preview panels.
          See Also:
          Tetrion.nextShapes

        • statusbar

          javax.swing.JLabel statusbar
          Status Bar.
